title: Spaghetti Carbonara
summary: A classic Italian pasta dish with eggs, cheese, bacon, and black pepper.
instructions: Boil spaghetti in salted water until al dente, then drain and reserve some pasta water.
In a pan, cook pancetta until crispy, then add minced garlic.
In a bowl, whisk eggs with grated Parmesan cheese and black pepper.
Remove pan from heat, add spaghetti, and mix with pancetta.
Slowly stir in egg mixture, adding pasta water if needed to create a creamy sauce.
Serve immediately with extra Parmesan on top.

title: Locally Made Waakye
summary: Waakye is a classic Ghanaian dish made from rice and beans, cooked together with dried millet leaves for a natural reddish-brown color.
ingredients: 1 cup black-eyed peas or red beans
instructions: Soak beans overnight, then rinse and drain.
Boil beans with millet leaves and baking soda until tender.
Add washed rice, salt, and more water if needed, then cook until rice is soft and absorbed the color.
Remove millet leaves and fluff rice.
Serve with shito (hot pepper sauce), fried plantain, or meat of choice.

title: Chicken Tikka Masala
summary: Chunks of grilled chicken (tikka) cooked in a smooth buttery & creamy tomato-based gravy.
instructions: Marinate chicken in yogurt, lemon juice, and spices for at least 2 hours.
Grill or pan-fry chicken until cooked.
In a pan, sauté ginger-garlic paste with cumin, then add tomato puree and simmer.
Stir in heavy cream and grilled chicken, letting it cook for another 5 minutes.
Serve hot with naan or rice.

title: Chilli Mania
summary: This fiery rice recipe combines fragrant basmati rice with a medley of chili peppers, savory spices, and hearty ingredients like vegetables, beans, or protein of your choice.
ingredients: 1 cup mixed bell peppers (red, green, yellow), diced
instructions: Cook basmati rice until fluffy and set aside.
Heat olive oil in a pan, add chopped chilies and bell peppers, and sauté for 3 minutes.
Add cumin powder, paprika, and kidney beans, then stir well.
Mix in the cooked rice, season with salt and pepper, and cook for another 5 minutes.
Serve hot with your favorite protein or as a spicy side dish.
